title: `forge test --debug` crashes my entire computer
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (29ff0b0 2022-08-20T00:03:58.583580886Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test --debug

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Was using `forge test --debug` during the paradigm ctf and on `fun-reversing` halfway through the challenge the debugger crashed my computer lmao. I was able to capture some output by logging to file while my computer was crashing, but it doesn't seem particularly helpful. It's reproducible so let me know if anything else would help debug this. 

```
earlier... > RUST_BACKTRACE=1 RUST_LOG=forge,foundry_evm,ui forge test --debug testReversing > error.txt


> cat error.txt

```

Same experience on this challenge. Seems to be related to the amount of memory expansion the challenge program creates alongside the amount of opcodes needed to step through. 

I'm unsure of the root cause, we were thinking that memory state is being stored per opcode so long traces blow up to GB+?

cc @brockelmore

this should be resolved now with #2877

please reopen if you see this again
